title: Avial (vegetables in yoghurt)

ingredients.content: 3 fresh long green chillies, trimmed and cut into halves
100 g potato, cut into batons (1 x 5 cm)
100 g sweet potato, cut into batons (1 x 5 cm)
200 g carrot, cut into batons (1 x 5 cm)
200 g fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into halves

preparations.content: Place coconut, green chillies, cumin seeds, 50 g of the water and 80 g of the yoghurt into mixing bowl and blend <b>20 sec/speed 8<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend <b>20 sec/speed 8<b> or until smooth. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place garam masala, turmeric, Tamarind paste, salt and remaining 250 g water into mixing bowl and heat <b>5 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>.
Add vegetables and cook <b>5-7 min/100°C//speed <b> or until vegetables are cooked to your liking, but still crisp.

Add all of the reserved coconut paste and remaining 60 g yoghurt and cook <b>3 min/90°C//speed <b>. Transfer vegetables into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place coconut oil into mixing bowl and heat <b>3 min/Varoma/speed 2<b>.
Add curry leaves and mustard seeds and cook <b>1 min/Varoma/speed 1<b> or until they begin to pop. Pour over vegetables and stir well to combine, then serve immediately.

hintsAndTricks: Fresh coconut can be replaced with frozen grated coconut - both can be found at Asian and Indian food stores.
To make your own garam masala and Tamarind paste, please refer to the recipes on this recipe chip.
